docs.text: earth is a harsh , unconsoling drama about the time when india gained independence from britain and the ensuing turmoil that engulfed the subcontinent .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: people who supposedly loved the same land and the same god found themselves in bitter conflict , as the country divided into factions fighting in the streets : indian and pakistani ; muslim , hindu , sikh , parsee .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story takes place in lahore , which was indian before partition , and pakistani afterward , regardless of what its citizens might call themselves .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the action is seen through the eyes of lenny ( maaia sethna ) , a young parsee girl , but it is really about her nanny , shanta .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: shanta has a small circle of male admirers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: two of the men are suitors : hasan ( rahul khanna ) , a hindu , and dil navaz ( aamir khan ) , a muslim .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the others--sikh , hindu , muslim--are older ; some are married ; but all appreciate shanta , who is played by the stirringly beautiful nandita das .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( she also starred in deepa mehta's previous film , fire , the first part of a thematic trilogy which will conclude with water . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in an early scene , the men are sitting in a park talking with shanta and lenny ; political tension in the country is growing as the day of independence nears .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one of the men remarks , jokingly , that their little group is probably one of the last places in the city where the different religions can still get along .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is wrong : the men make barbed little comments to each other , spoken like jokes , but with an undercurrent of fanaticism .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the tenor of these exchanges grows darker and more bitter as the movie progresses .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is easy to perceive , in these squabbles , the trajectory which ends in mass violence and slaughter .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the group around shanta represents , in a sense , a united india , and shanta herself the ideal motherland--one which all love , which inspires hindu , muslim , and sikh to live peacably together .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but the circle around shanta is sundered , as is the state .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a sikh is persecuted , hides , then flees .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: another man is murdered .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the group of friends will not meet again .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie is rife with images of breakage and destruction : a plate shattered on the floor , a stuffed toy torn apart by an upset child , and , most brutally , when the tension escalates into violence , a man is held down , tied between two cars , and ripped in half by the opposing movement of the vehicles .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is a visceral and effective metaphor for a country which is being destroyed just as painfully .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the crux of earth's plot is the transformation undergone by dil navaz .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his sisters are killed in brutal fashion , by hindus , because they are muslim .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dil navaz seeks solace from shanta , and asks in desperation that she marry him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but she loves hasan , and tenderly refuses dil navaz's offer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the combination of familial anguish and romantic rejection twists inside him , and it is easy to see how he is seduced by the growing mob mentality : the muslim cause gives him a motive to vent his anger and hate .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: despite the things he later does , it is to the credit of earth that it does not simply denounce dil navaz and those like him , but shows how circumstances can make decent enough men do monstrous things .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the conclusion--the consequence of dil navaz's transformation--is rather abrupt .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story earth tells does not end .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it just stops .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is an appropriate finish : giving us closure would have imparted , at least on an aesthetic level , a sense of resolution , of satisfaction .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but there was no resolution for india and pakistan--they have been at war , on a small or large scale , for decades .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: since the personal dramas in earth mirror the political struggles of a nation , it is only right that those dramas should have no terminus .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is no healing to be had , no closure , on any level ( despite the needless , tacked-on ending , with voice-over narration from lenny as an adult , framing the story ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: earth is , in some ways , an unexceptional movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it does not reinvent the wheel , following instead the standard pattern of historical dramas .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but deepa mehta's directon is assured , and the issues she addresses run deep .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: earth does for india what movies like zhang yimou's to live and tian zhuangzhuang's the blue kite did for china : they show us the agonies endured by unremarkable people who had the bad luck to be caught up and smashed in the crucible of history .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: such films strike me as inherently valuable , even when flawed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they may be biased or inaccurate , but they bear the weight of human hardship , and this confers on them a nobility and gravity which other , more inventive films , often lack .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is notable that all three movies were banned in their native countries : the events shown may have happened decades ago , but they still touch a nerve .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the issues tackled in earth have a particular urgency in light of the nuclear test bombings that took place last year .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the near future , india and pakistan may launch nuclear missiles at each other .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at the time of the tests i had some understanding of the reasons why this might happen ; after seeing earth , i have a much , much better understanding .
docs.label: positive
